alert.note: Alert for Brown; Custer; Garfield; Holt; Loup; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 6:56PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT ROCK...LOUP...SOUTHEASTERN BROWN...WESTERN GARFIELD...WESTERN HOLT...NORTHEASTERN CUSTER... EASTERN BLAINE AND SOUTHEASTERN KEYA PAHA COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM CDT... At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bassett to 7 miles east of Brewster to 9 miles east of Dunning. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burwell, Bassett, Taylor, Brewster, Atkinson, Stuart, Sargent, Long Pine, Newport, Rose, Amelia, Calamus Reservoir State Recreation Area, Milburn Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Fox Bayou, Almeria Meadow State Wildlife Management Area, Virginia Smith Dam, Twin Lakes State Wildlife Management Area, Kent Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area, Carson Lake, and Duff. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 114 and 182. Highway 20 between mile markers 250 and 297. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Custer; Garfield; Holt; Loup; Rock
